unit_learning_outcomes.description: Design and implement learning experiences to support the reading and writing development of students in the later years of primary school.
Explain the role and value of language, literacy and literature across the curriculum in later primary school (Yr 3 - 6) contexts.
Critically reflect upon pedagogy for literacy learning experiences in the later years of primary school.
Integrate ICT effectively in language and literacy instruction.
Apply differentiated literacy instruction to cater for diverse learners.
Apply evidence based literacy strategies for students in the later years of primary school.

data.subject_search_title: EDST4100 - Teaching English Language and Literacies in the later Primary School Years
data.description: This unit introduces students to teaching principles and strategies for promoting the language and literacy skills of diverse learners across the later primary school years. Building on EDST3100, the focus of EDST4100 moves from 'learning to read' and 'learning to write' to 'reading to learn' and composing effective written and multimodal texts. The unit will also examine how teachers can use oral language interactions and a range of quality everyday and literary texts in their classrooms. The pedagogic emphasis is on a continuous cycle of explicit, systematic, and evidence-based instruction for all students.
